subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0198_01C9E83C.DF7469C0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
	boundary="----=_NextPart_001_0199_01C9E83C.DF7469C0"


------=_NextPart_001_0199_01C9E83C.DF7469C0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Here is some food for thought. I am currently reviewing my audio from our M=
ay 30th investigation.

It was me and another girl teammate present in the =
room. I picked up a 3rd female voice on my digital voice recorder that I ca=
rry with me. We were standing right next to another digital video recorder =
that I leave beside my night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up t=
his 3rd voice. I have asked the girl that was with me to check her recordin=
g to see if she picked it up.

I have long felt the true EVP does not come =
from sound waves in the environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a dise=
mbodied voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.

Thi=
s instance with the recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder =
should have picked that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.=


I am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. The file that is named "01-02-=
17 Clip" is the full clip. You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then=
 another comes in right after that. I think I know what it says.

Again, I =
was live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this until playback. I=
t isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's from the last in=
vestigation.


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Ratka 
  To: E=
VP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
  Subject: Re=
: [EVP-ITC] New ideas





        I have a running theory that EVP is carr=
ied on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to man=
ifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic wav=
es that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them to=
gether you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a g=
host is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room cr=
eating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate d=
ifference frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz=
). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultraso=
nic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EV=
P were generated within a few inches of the recorder.

        We are able =
to reproduce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but=
 also with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial p=
roduce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.

        Frank R=
.

        --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...> wrote:


  =
        From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-=
ITC] New ideas
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date: Monday=
, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM


          Fascinating! I've had this idea that th=
e EVP are often not recorded by the microphone but somehow make their way i=
n at the actual point where the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape=
) or digital. 

          So much we don't know ...

          Zack

      =
     
          On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@ab=
ercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:




            I monitor my audio liv=
e. The funny thing is that even so, those last EVP's I captured I did not h=
ear either in the environment, or on my recording as it happened. I only he=
ard them upon playback.

              ----- Original Message ----- 
      =
        From: Zack Widup 
              To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
     =
         Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
              Subject: Re: [E=
VP-ITC] New ideas


              I am curious if anyone with a microphone =
wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.

             =
 I took part in an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Sa=
turday night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls of the bui=
lding. The video for all was being monitored and recorded at a central loca=
tion. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera sites conected to the=
 central location. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?

          =
    Zack

               
              On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 12:05 PM, th=
readsintyme@ juno.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:


              Let'=
s just agree to end this discussion about her... 
              Why don't w=
e discuss something on a lighter note? Anyone have any new ideas about eith=
er evp or ITC? 
              Al

       



  
------=_NextPart_001_0199_01C9E83C.DF7469C0
